top_categories.workout_context: Gravel Earth Series’s 208-mile distance demands power production deep into fatigue — the defining challenge of ultra-distance gravel.
Gravel Earth Series’s european gravel, volcanic fields demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Gravel Earth Series isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Every session at Gravel Earth Series intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.

Gravel Earth Series’s mixed gravel, from smooth european roads to technical african game trails and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
At 208 miles, Gravel Earth Series rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Gravel Earth Series when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Gravel Earth Series — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Gravel Earth Series rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Gravel Earth Series’s mixed gravel, from smooth european roads to technical african game trails delivers on race day.
Gravel Earth Series’s 12,139ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.

Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Gravel Earth Series — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on mixed gravel, from smooth european roads to technical african game trails.

race_overlay.heat: February in Global (HQ: Girona, Spain) can bring heat. Complete 3–4 heat exposure sessions in the final 2 weeks before Gravel Earth Series. Increase sodium intake 48 hours before race day.
race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 208 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 208 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Gravel Earth Series. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Gravel Earth Series demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride mixed gravel, from smooth european roads to technical african game trails at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: european gravel, volcanic fields, desert terrain. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 208 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Gravel Specific, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 208 miles of mixed gravel, from smooth european roads to technical african game trails in Global (HQ: Girona, Spain).
